education.description: It was at DU that I discovered my passion for Web Development. Through my Web courses, I became absolutely fascinated by Web Development as a creative outlet - when you can build any kind of website you want, what do you choose to make? Besides Web Development, I have also stayed involved on campus by holding positions on DU's Programming Board (DUPB) and our InterFraternity Council's Executive Board - learn more about those below. In addition to my coursework and campus involvement, I am also proud to say that I have made the Dean's List for the Spring 2019, Fall 2019, and Winter 2020 quarters for earning a 3.75+ GPA while taking at least 15 credit hours; and awarded Hornbeck Honors for earning a 4.0 GPA while taking 15+ credit hours in the Fall 2019 quarter.

experience.description: As a member of DUPB's 15-person Traditions Committee, I worked to conceptualize, market, and manage some of the largest recurring community-wide events DU has to offer. Along with Homecoming, my committee was responsible for our yearly 'Winter Carnival' and 'May Days' events. Winter Carnival is week-long and consists of large-scale on-campus events each weekday that 'concludes' on Friday with DUPB providing round-trip transportation for upwards of 1600 students to the nearby Keystone Ski Resort where discounted lift tickets/housing and daily on-mountain events await. During the process of planning these sets of high-budget events, I was responsible for drafting, negotiating, and finalizing service contracts with multiple third-party vendors to ensure everything went as smoothly as possible.

experience.description: When I first joined 3 Brothers Odd Jobs, it was a small LLC that mainly did yard work for the residents of my neighborhood. During my time there, I trained and oversaw new local workforce members to insure consistently high-quality service on projects and grew the company to become a well-known throughout my area. As well as being a Project Manager, I also organized and distributed payroll to our employee network weekly in a transparent and fair manner.

leadership.title: Director of Recruitment
leadership.description: As the IFC Director of Recruitment, I am responsible for planning, promoting, and administering Fall and Spring rounds of recruitment for all recognized fraternities at DU. I am the primary point of contact for each fraternity's VP of Recruitment, as well as chapter advisers, school administrators, and all students considering and/or participating in fraternity recruitment. When COVID-19 closed DU's campus in the Spring of 2020, I quickly adapted the recruitment format to accommodate to each chapter's and potential new member's needs.

leadership.title: Council Member
leadership.description: In 2016, Sewickley Academy's high school shifted their student-run governing body from a Student Council structure to a House Council structure. What's the difference? In a House Council, every student - regardless of grade - was a member of a particular 'House' (yes, like in Harry Potter) and elected four students to represent their House. The House system was implemented in an effort to make our high school more 'vertically integrated' such that student friend groups weren't as solely-reliant on what grade they were in (dubbed 'horizontal integration'), but could also be influenced what House they were a member of. The House Council was responsible for collaborating with fellow students, school administrators, and third-party organizations to design and oversee events and competitions in order to uphold school and House spirit alike. It was an honor to be elected by my classmates to represent them and entrusted help to set the foundation for this new system, then to be re-elected the following year to uphold the precedent that had been set.
